content:
I have a small number of Lean files - 24 in total.

The lean files, being plain text, take up a tiny about of space, 12K in total. The .lake folder however takes up about 3Gb !!

Question - is this normal?

My lean toolchain file has only one line leanprover/lean4:v4.13.0 and the makefile.lean is also small and I think fairly vanilla.

Did my .lake grow unnecessarily large though several "updates"?

% du -c -h -A -B1 *.lean

145B    01_first_proof.lean
205B    02_simple_calc.lean

 12K    total

and just the .lake folder is 2.8 Gb !!

du -c -h -B1 .lake
..
..
2.9G    total
.lake also includes dependencies including the compiled olean files. If you have Mathlib as a dependency, it can be at least that big.
